title: WordPress Web Developer & Designer
description:
About Scaliency:



Scaliency is a Phoenix, Arizona-based growth marketing agency that builds complete growth systems for service-based businesses -- websites, paid ads (Google & Meta), SEO, content, CRM automation, and AI-powered lead management. Our clients include home service companies, auto repair shops, contractors, coaches, retail shops, and other service businesses across the US. We're growing quickly and are building our core team to support that growth.





Job Description:



You will be Scaliency's primary website builder and designer. You'll redesign outdated client websites into modern, conversion-focused sites (about 60% of projects), build brand-new WordPress websites from scratch (about 40%), create landing pages for ad campaigns, and maintain all client websites. Everything you build is what clients and prospects see first -- so it needs to be polished, mobile-responsive, and built to convert visitors into leads.





Responsibilities:



- Build and redesign WordPress websites using Elementor Pro -- from template selection to final QA and launch.



- Generate page content using our AI tools (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT), then edit everything for natural readability and brand voice.



- Implement conversion elements across all sites -- forms, pop-ups, CTAs, click-to-call, chat widgets, booking calendars.



- Build dedicated landing pages for PPC campaigns.



- Create reusable Elementor page templates for our SEO Specialist to publish ongoing content.



- Configure on-page SEO technicals on builds (RankMath, heading hierarchy, alt text, clean URLs).



- Maintain all client WordPress sites -- plugin updates, speed optimization, security, content updates.



- Embed external forms and widgets (GoHighLevel, Gravity Forms, other CRM forms, review widgets, calendars).



- Coordinate with our SEO Specialist and Tracking Specialist to ensure sites support the full marketing system.





Requirements:



- 3+ years WordPress development with Elementor / Elementor Pro.



- Strong visual design sense -- your sites look custom and polished.



- Experience redesigning existing websites (template swaps, rebrands, page restructuring).



- Experience building WordPress websites from scratch.



- High-conversion page design understanding (CTA placement, mobile-first layout, user flow).



- Mobile-responsive design across all devices.



- Excellent written & spoken English



- Page speed optimization (image compression, lazy loading, efficient Elementor usage).



- On-page SEO Experience (RankMath or Yoast, heading structure, meta tags, alt text).

title: Environmental Data Anaylst - Dallas, TX (Remote)
description:
Remote Virtual Assistant – Data Analyst (Dallas, TX Market)

Company: MSE Environmental

Location: Remote (Serving the Dallas, TX Market)

Schedule: Night Shift (Dallas CDT) — 8:00 AM to 6:30 PM CDT

Type: Independent Contractor

Industry: Environmental Consulting & Industrial Hygiene

About Us

MSE Environmental is a rapidly growing environmental consulting firm recognized as a leader in environmental testing and industrial hygiene services. With operations across Texas, Nevada, and California, we specialize in asbestos, lead, mold, and bacteria assessments, as well as Phase I Environmental Site Assessments.



Our mission is simple: provide responsive, accurate, and compliant environmental solutions that protect our clients and communities.

Learn more about our culture and values here: 

Position Overview

We are seeking a Virtual Assistant – Data Analyst to support our Dallas, TX operations. This remote role requires exceptional attention to detail, professionalism, and communication skills. You will collaborate closely with Project Managers and Environmental Consultants to prepare laboratory reports, interpret data, manage client communications, and ensure timely delivery of accurate results.



This is an excellent opportunity for individuals interested in business operations, customer service, or environmental science, and who want to grow within a respected and expanding organization.

Key Responsibilities

• Prepare environmental laboratory reports for Asbestos, Lead, Mold, or Bacteria with precision and speed.

• Interpret laboratory data with Environmental Consultants and relay results to clients within 15 minutes or less after receipt.

• Assist Project Managers and Environmental Consultants in laboratory results preparation and client updates.

• Provide excellent customer service and phone/email communication to clients.

• Coordinate with field staff, vendors, and laboratories to ensure timely delivery of results.

• Respond to high-volume
 and phone inquiries professionally and efficiently.

• Utilize software platforms such as Google Workspace, Slack, Aircall, and CRM tools daily.

• Manage multiple assignments simultaneously while maintaining accuracy and organization.

Qualifications

• 2+ years of experience in customer service or administrative support.

• Excellent English communication (written and verbal) and phone etiquette — C1 level English proficiency preferred.

• Proficiency with Windows 7 or higher, Microsoft Word/Excel, Outlook, and Google Workspace.

• Typing speed: 50+ WPM (will be tested).

• Strong organizational and multitasking skills.

• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

• Prior experience in environmental services or industrial hygiene (preferred, not required).

• Must have a quiet, distraction-free home office setup with no animals or background noise, including:

• Reliable computer (8 GB RAM minimum)

• 25+ Mbps internet connection

• Noise-cancelling headset.

Schedule

Monday – Friday: 8:00 AM – 6:30 PM (Dallas CDT)

Must be flexible for occasional extended hours or urgent client needs.

Required Screening Questions

• What is your temperament type (Sanguine, Choleric, Melancholic, or Phlegmatic)?

• Do you work well with others?

• Do you have good English phone etiquette?

• Have you ever worked nights before?

• Do you agree to live and work by the MSE Environmental Foundations of Our Brand? (Yes/No)

Speaking Test Instructions

As part of your application, please complete a short English speaking test.



Record yourself reading the paragraph below using 
 or 
.

Once complete, include your recording link at the top of your cover letter or
 reply.

Speaking Test Paragraph

Hi Erik,

My name is [Your Name], and I’m excited to apply for the Virtual Assistant – Data Analyst position at MSE Environmental. I have strong English communication skills and a background in customer service, data reporting, and administrative support.

I take pride in being detail-oriented and reliable, and I understand the importance of accuracy and professionalism when communicating with clients.

I’m confident that my experience, work ethic, and commitment to providing excellent service align with the values of MSE Environmental.

Thank you for considering my application — I look forward to the opportunity to contribute to your team.

Compensation

This is a contractor position with competitive hourly pay, commensurate with experience and performance.

To Apply

Please send your resume, cover letter, and speaking test link to our hiring team.

Applications missing any required information will not be reviewed.

title: Virtual Assistant - Food & Bev Industry
description:

We’re looking for a reliable Administrative Virtual Assistant to handle invoicing, accounts receivable tracking, reconciliation prep, tax-summary prep, and organized documentation.



This is a strictly administrative role. No marketing, no strategy, no decision-making. The goal is to keep financial records clean, admin work off the founder’s plate, and partner materials easy to find and share.

Track payments and reconcile AR by account



Prepare a simple AR summary (paid / outstanding / overdue)



Flag issues or discrepancies

Match invoices to bank transactions



Pull together sales, expenses, and tax data



Create a clear HST summary table for the accountant

(You prepare; accountant files)

Keep business documents organized and up to date



Create share-ready folders for:



Distributor and retailer forms



Promotions and demo materials



Product specs, UPCs, nutritionals, images



Make sure files are easy to find and quick to share



4. SOPs & Documentation



Write simple SOPs for admin tasks (invoicing, AR, reconciliation, content organization)



Keep SOPs updated for future reference and onboarding



5. Admin Updates



Short weekly status update



Prepare quarterly hand-off package for accountant



Tools You’ll Use



Xero, Square (invoicing & payments)



Google Suite (Sheets, Docs, Drive, Gmail)



WhatsApp (communication)



Canva (organizing approved assets only)



ChatGPT (summaries, SOP formatting, documentation help)



Time Commitment



8 hours per week



One 1-hour live work session per week (Google Meet)



Remaining hours completed independently



Out of Scope (Important)



Marketing or content creation



Social media or newsletters



Pricing or sales decisions



Customer negotiations or collections



Tax filing or legal decisions



Ideal Fit



Very organized and detail-oriented



Comfortable with numbers and spreadsheets



Follows instructions and boundaries



Communicates clearly and flags issues early

title: Healthcare Recruiter
description:
Job description:



We are a growing U.S.-based healthcare company seeking a Recruiter / Interview Specialist to support therapist hiring across multiple departments.



This role is call-heavy and interview-focused, with additional responsibility for coordinating hiring needs and tracking recruitment progress. Approximately 90% of your work will involve phone interviews with therapist candidates.



If you are not comfortable being on calls for most of your shift, this role is not a good fit.



Role Overview



• You will conduct daily phone interviews with licensed therapists (PT, OT, ST, PTA, COTA), coordinate with internal teams on hiring needs, and manage the recruitment pipeline from job posting through candidate handoff.

 • You are the first point of contact for candidates and a key link between departments, so professionalism, organization, and communication are essential.



Key Responsibilities



• Interviewing & Screening (Primary Focus)

• Conduct high-volume phone interviews daily with therapist candidates.

• Screen candidates for: Licensure and credentials, Experience and specialties, Availability and geographic coverage, 



Communication skills and professionalism

• Clearly explain roles, expectations, and next steps.

• Identify red flags and escalate concerns when necessary.

• Recruitment Coordination & Follow-Ups

• Follow up with candidates after interviews as needed.

• Coordinate with internal departments (staffing, operations, leadership) to understand current and upcoming hiring needs.

• Schedule next steps and hand off qualified candidates appropriately.

• Maintain timely and professional communication with candidates throughout the process.

• Job Posting & Process Tracking

• Post job openings on approved platforms as hiring needs change.

• Track candidates through each stage of the recruitment process.

• Keep recruitment trackers or ATS accurate and up to date.

• Provide basic updates on hiring progress when requested.



What We’re Looking For



• Comfortable being on the phone most of the workday.

• Clear, confident, professional speaking voice.

• Strong listening and judgment skills.

• Highly organized and detail-oriented.

• Able to manage follow-ups and coordination without losing 
ntum.



Qualifications



• 1–2+ years of experience in: Recruiting, Healthcare staffing, HR screening, Call center interviewing

• Excellent spoken and written English.

• Comfortable conducting multiple interviews per day.

• Familiar with Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs).

• Bonus: Experience recruiting healthcare professionals or independent contractors.



Requirements



• Reliable internet connection.

• Quiet, professional work environment for calls.

• Ability to work U.S. (PST) business hours.

• Part-time or full-time availability (to be discussed).



Job Type: Part-time



Benefits:



• Paid training

• Work from home



Experience:



• Recruiting: 2 years (Required)

• Healthcare Staffing: 1 year (Required)

• Work Location: Remote

title: Web Developer Needed to Build a Mission-Driven Website for inara (Fintech / Community Platform)
description:
inara is a community savings platform that helps people access meaningful capital without relying on loans, interest, or predatory lenders. We’re building infrastructure around contribution-based savings systems that already exist in communities worldwide and bringing structure, transparency, and safeguards to them.



This is not a generic fintech project. This is mission-driven work focused on financial resilience, trust, and long-term impact.



What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for a skilled web developer who can build a clean, modern, trustworthy website that reflects inara’s values and credibility. This site will be used by community partners, institutions, philanthropies, and early users, so clarity, polish, and restraint matter more than flash.



You should be comfortable working from written concepts and collaborating closely to translate vision into a strong digital presence.



Scope of Work

• Design and build a responsive, modern marketing website

• Pages likely include: Home, How It Works, Why inara, Pilots & Partnerships, About, Contact

• Clean, accessible UI with a strong emphasis on trust and clarity

• Mobile-first and performance-conscious

• SEO-friendly structure

• Deployed and ready for real-world use



Tech Stack (Flexible)

We’re open to recommendations. You might use Webflow, Next.js, React, or another modern stack as long as the result is fast, secure, and maintainable. Please explain your choice.



Ideal Candidate

• Strong portfolio of real, live websites (not just templates)

• Experience building marketing or product websites for startups, fintech, or mission-driven orgs

• Good design judgment and attention to detail

• Clear communicator who asks thoughtful questions

• Comfortable taking ownership of a project end-to-end

• Values long-term collaboration over quick one-offs



Nice to Have

• Experience with fintech, SaaS, or regulated industries

• Familiarity with accessibility best practices

• Ability to suggest improvements rather than just execute instructions



Compensation

Paid, project-based. Please include your proposed rate or range and how you typically scope projects like this. There is potential for ongoing work as inara grows.



How to Apply

Please include:

• A short intro about you

• Links to 2–3 relevant websites you’ve built

• Your recommended tech stack for this project (and why)

• Your estimated timeline

• Your rate or project estimate



We care deeply about how inara shows up in the world. If you take pride in building thoughtful, well-crafted work and want to contribute to something meaningful, we’d love to hear from you.



We are open to increasing the budget for exceptional candidates who demonstrate strong portfolio quality and fast turnaround.

title: AFFILIATE MANAGER
description:
AFFILIATE MANAGER



NordStick



NordStick is a leading fitness brand founded in 2020 by a prominent physical therapist, dedicated to innovative home based workout solutions that help people overcome pain, prevent injuries, and achieve peak performance. Our flagship products, like the NordStick and NordBench Pro, are affordable, high quality, and multifunctional, empowering over 250,000 customers to build strength and improve mobility without a gym. As part of a fast growing DTC fitness ecosystem, we're committed to making health and wellness accessible. This is not a lifestyle brand. It is a long term company with high expectations around execution, ownership, and reliability.



The Role



We are hiring an Affiliate Manager to own and scale NordStick’s creator and affiliate partnerships.

This is not a passive “send a few
s and hope someone posts” role. You are responsible for building a real revenue channel through creators and partners.



You will identify the right people, reach out, close partnerships, manage deliverables, track performance, and make sure affiliates actually drive results.



If you need constant direction, this role will feel overwhelming. If you naturally spot opportunities, follow through, and treat outcomes like they’re your own business, you will thrive.



You will operate across marketing, ecommerce, and operations, working directly with the Founder and internal team to turn partnerships into consistent growth.



Core Responsibilities



1. Affiliate Strategy and Outreach

--> Lead creator research and qualification across Instagram,
, and YouTube, focusing on U.S. based influencers and affiliates who align with the brand

 --> Manage outbound and inbound creator outreach and prospecting

 --> Build and maintain a consistent pipeline of high quality partners

 --> Draft and manage partnership agreements and contracts



2. Partner Onboarding and Execution

--> Own partner onboarding including whitelisting setup, expectations alignment, and launch timelines

 --> Coordinate product seeding and create orders for affiliates

 --> Track and manage creator deliverables throughout each phase of the campaign

 --> Act as the primary point of contact for partners across the full lifecycle



3. Operations and Performance Management

--> Maintain and manage partnership workflows and tasks in Asana

 --> Generate and analyze performance reports for affiliate campaigns

 --> Track affiliate payouts and ensure timely and accurate compensation

 --> Identify what is working, what is not, and proactively optimize for better results



What Success Looks Like



Within 30 Days

--> Active pipeline of qualified creators and affiliates

 --> Outreach and onboarding systems clearly organized and repeatable

 --> First partnerships launched without hand holding



Within 90 Days

--> Affiliate channel driving consistent and measurable revenue

 --> Partners managed proactively with clear expectations and accountability

 --> Reporting is reliable, data driven, and used to guide decisions

 --> Founder is not chasing follow ups, payments, or missed deliverables



Requirements



You should not apply unless most of the following are true:

--> You have managed affiliate, influencer, or creator partnerships for ecommerce or DTC brands

 --> You are highly organized and comfortable juggling multiple relationships and timelines

 --> You are proactive and take ownership without waiting for instructions

 --> You communicate clearly and directly with partners and internal teams

 --> You are comfortable negotiating agreements and setting expectations

 --> You can analyze performance data and translate it into actions

 --> You have experience with tools like Asana, Shopify, Google Sheets, and affiliate or tracking platforms

 --> You understand how creators, paid media, and ecommerce work together to drive sales

 --> You can commit full time, working 40 hours per week



How to Apply



Send a message with:

--> Your resume

 --> A brief overview of why you are a strong fit for this role

 --> Any relevant experience managing affiliates, influencers, or creator campaigns

title: Part-Time WordPress + SEO VA (Web Developer / SEO Specialist)
description:
Job Overview



We’re hiring a part-time WordPress + SEO VA to help maintain and improve our website, publish/optimize content, and grow organic traffic through clean technical SEO and on-page best practices.



This is an ongoing role (not a one-time project). You’ll work directly with the owner and help implement web updates quickly, keep things organized, and track improvements over time.



Responsibilities



WordPress / Website

 • Update and maintain WordPress pages (Elementor or Gutenberg—tell us what you use)

 • Create new pages/landing pages from provided copy and structure

 • Improve page speed, mobile responsiveness, and basic UX

 • Add tracking pixels / scripts when needed (GA4, Meta, etc.)

 • Troubleshoot common plugin/theme issues and site errors

 • Basic security + backups coordination (plugin-based)



SEO (On-Page + Technical + Local)

 • On-page SEO for service pages + blog posts (titles, headings, internal linking, image alt text, schema where appropriate)

 • Technical SEO checks (indexing, sitemaps, redirects, broken links, canonical tags)

 • Keyword research for local service SEO (Seattle/King County focus)

 • Optimize Google Business Profile basics (as needed)

 • Create simple monthly reporting: rankings, traffic, top pages, wins + next actions



Required Skills

 • Strong WordPress experience (you can build/edit pages confidently)

 • Solid SEO fundamentals + execution (not just theory)

 • Familiar with tools like: Google Search Console, GA4, PageSpeed Insights, Ahrefs/Ubersuggest/SEMrush (any is fine)

 • Comfortable documenting work + following SOPs/checklists

 • Great written English for SEO edits and page formatting



Nice-to-Haves

 • Elementor experience

 • Local SEO experience (service-area businesses)

 • Basic graphic editing (Canva) for web images

 • Experience with schema (LocalBusiness/Service/FAQ) and SEO plugins (Rank Math / Yoast)



Work Hours + Pay

 • Part-time: 10–20 hours/week to start

 • Schedule: Flexible, but must overlap at least 2 hours/week for communication

 • Please include your hourly rate and your typical weekly availability

 • Long-term opportunity for the right fit

How We Work

 • Time tracking: Clockify (accurate time logs + notes on what was completed)

 • Communication: Pumble (quick, real-time collaboration + updates)

 • Task management: Plaky (clear tasks, priorities, due dates, and status tracking)

title: Client Experience Specialist
description:
Brilliant Brothers Services

Position: Client Experience Specialist (Full-Time Virtual Role)

Full Time Role - 40 Hours per Week. 8am to 430pm Pacific Time, Monday to Friday.

With Quarterly Reviews and Annual Raises.

Victoria, BC (Pacific Time)



8-Year, 15 Person Organization



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



?? PLEASE READ BEFORE APPLYING

This is a high-level client-facing phone role.



You will be the FIRST voice our clients hear.



Because we serve homeowners in Canada, this role requires:

- Neutral North American–style English pronunciation

- Extremely clear speech

- Warm, natural, conversational tone

- Strong emotional intelligence

- Ability to build trust within the first 10 seconds



If your speech is difficult to understand, heavily accented, robotic, monotone, or lacks natural conversational warmth, this role will not be a fit.



We WILL require a video or audio submission before interviews.



If you cannot confidently and clearly say:

“Thank you for calling Brilliant Brothers Services, this is [Name], how can I help you today?”

 in a warm, polished, natural tone, please do not apply!



We are looking for excellence, not average.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



About Us

Brilliant Brothers Services is a fast-growing exterior cleaning company based in Victoria, British Columbia.



We don’t just clean homes.



We deliver 5-star client experiences.



And the experience starts with YOU.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



The Role

- Answer inbound calls

- Book jobs

- Build estimates

- Respond to
s & texts

- Support Sales & Production Managers

- Maintain 96%+ client satisfaction



This role is primarily phone-based.



You must enjoy speaking to people all day.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What We’re Looking For

You MUST:

- Speak extremely clear, easy-to-understand English

- Have a neutral North American–friendly tone

- Sound confident (never unsure or casual like “yeah?”)

- Be emotionally intelligent and empathetic

- Be able to handle objections and help sell jobs

- Think quickly on your feet

- Work in a quiet space where you will not be bothered

- Take detailed notes within 2 minutes of every call

- Be extremely organized

- Work Monday–Friday, 8:00am–4:30pm Pacific Time

- Not be working another job



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What This Role Is NOT

This is NOT:

- A passive data-entry job

- A quiet back-office role

- A script-reading position

- A place for someone uncomfortable on the phone

This is a high-performance client experience role.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Compensation & Benefits

- $600 USD paid every 2 weeks. ($1,200 USD per month)

- Paid bi-weekly

- Paid Days OFF during Canadian holidays (BC schedule)

- Long-term growth opportunity

- Supportive management team

- Performance-based advancement opportunities



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Tools & Experience Required

- Very Clear Accent & English Speaking (Non-negotiable)

- CRM experience (Jobber preferred)

- Google Workspace proficiency

- VOIP/dialer experience

- NOTICE: When you apply for this position through this hiring ad, please insert “PURPLEDRAGON88” at the beginning of your application message. (This shows attention to - detail. If you do not include this code, you will not be selected for this position.)

- Strong
 writing skills

- KPI tracking experience



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Required Work Setup

To do your best work, you’ll need a solid setup:

- Stable Internet (Minimum 50 Mbps)

- Computer or Laptop (nothing slow, please!)

- 2 Monitors (multitasking is a must)

- Webcam

- Headset with (good quality) mic

- Mouse & Keyboard

- Desk & Comfortable Chair

- Internet Router

- Backup Power Supply (UPS) – just in case

- Environment that you can talk loudly in



*** Other Must-Haves ***

- Very few (ideally no) power outages

- Can work Monday to Friday, 8:00am–4:30pm PST

- You are NOT working any other job right now

- Comfortable with:

- - - Speaking with customers on the phone (majority of the day)

- - - Basic IT troubleshooting

- - - Data entry & file organization



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How to Apply!



Interested in this role? Awesome!



Please apply directly through this hiring ad.



- - -  PLEASE DO NOT
 US OR CALL US — we’re only reviewing applications submitted through this platform.



If you’re a great fit, we’ll be in touch soon to set up the next step.

We can’t wait to meet you!



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



If you are chosen and we reach back out to you, we will be asking you to submit the following:



A 60-second video introducing yourself and what you do for fun.



A 30-second audio sample saying this:

Hi there! My name is ___[YOUR NAME]___, and I work at Brilliant Brothers Services! We specialize in exterior home cleaning services here in Victoria BC. That includes window cleaning, gutter cleaning, roof moss treatment, siding soft washing, and pressure washing. If you’d like, I can ask a couple quick questions about your home and help guide you toward what would be most helpful.”



We will be specifically listening for:

- Warmth

- Clarity

- Confidence

- Natural tone

- Emotional connection

title: Vacation Rental Operations Assistant
description:
Operations Assistant: Elevate Vacation Homes | U.S.-Based (San Diego, CA)



Read this carefully before applying.



We are a small but growing vacation rental company based in U.S. (San Diego, CA) managing 40+ properties, with 90% located in San Diego, California.

Our team is lean by design:

- 1 CEO

- 1 COO

- 1 CFO

- 2 Operations Assistants



We are now hiring one more Operations Assistant — and this is an important role. We are not hiring in volume. We are hiring one person we can grow with as we scale to 80–100 properties. If you perform well and stay with us, this role will naturally grow into a higher position when we expand.



Important Context (Read This Carefully)

We have been hiring and letting people go over the last 6 months. Not because of pay. Not because of workload. But because we are very selective and have not yet found the right long-term fit.



This role requires:

- Strong communication

- Good judgment

- Ownership

- Reliability under pressure



If you’re confident in your ability, this is a rare opportunity to join early and grow with the company. If you’re unsure, this is not the role for you. This Role Is For One Type of Person Only



You are:

- Fluent in spoken and written English

- Comfortable speaking on the phone with:

- Guests

- Vendors

- Homeowners

- Calm, logical, and clear under pressure

- Able to manage multiple issues at once

- A strong problem solver

- Someone who finishes what they start



You are not:

- A task-only VA

- Someone who avoids calls

- Someone who needs constant direction

- Someone who panics under stress

- Someone who relies on AI to communicate



Communication Expectations (Very Important)

You should expect:

- 5–20 phone calls per day



Daily coordination with:

- Cleaning teams

- Maintenance vendors

- Internal staff



If you are not confident speaking English on calls, do not apply.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing: This is not a customer service role.

Approximate breakdown:

- 10% Guest communication

- 5% Cleaning reminders

- 5% Ordering supplies

- 80% Operations, coordination, and problem-solving



You will function as:

- A project manager

- A communicator between teams

- A problem-solver when things go wrong

- A key operations support role



Work Environment

- Small, fast-moving startup

- High accountability

- Clear expectations

- Real responsibility

- Direct communication with leadership

- Opportunity to grow as the company scales



Compensation & Benefits

- Up to $8.00 USD/hour (based on performance)

- 10 days paid time off per year

- 2 days off per week

- Long-term role with growth potential

- Promotion opportunity as we scale to 80–100 properties



Final Note: We are not looking to hire quickly. We are looking to hire correctly. If you believe your experience, communication skills, and work ethic make you a strong fit — apply. If you are unsure, this role is not for you.



How to Apply



If you believe you are a strong fit and meet all of the requirements above, apply using the link below.

https://api.leadconnectorhq.com/widget/form/u5D8ACly2LEOjvjiC88x



Important:

Applications that are dis-honest, incomplete, generic, or clearly copy-pasted will be ignored. We are only moving forward with candidates who demonstrate strong communication, attention to detail, and professionalism. If you’re confident in your abilities and want to grow with a serious team — apply now.

title: Tax Perpare
description:
Tax Preparer Job Description

Position Title: Tax Preparer

Department: Finance / Administration

Reports To: Owner / Office Manager / Accountant

Employment Type: Part-Time / Full-Time / Seasonal

Position Summary

The Tax Preparer is responsible for preparing and filing tax returns accurately and on time. This role includes collecting financial information, entering data into tax software, organizing client records, and ensuring compliance with federal and state tax regulations. The Tax Preparer must maintain confidentiality, work independently, and provide professional customer service.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Prepare individual and/or business tax returns

Enter financial and tax information into tax software (data entry)

Organize and file tax documents (digital and paper)

Maintain accurate client records

Communicate with clients to obtain required documentation

Conduct basic tax and compliance research when needed

Ensure timely electronic filing of returns

Maintain confidentiality of financial information

Assist with administrative filing tasks

Required Qualifications

Minimum 5 years of tax preparation experience

PTIN (Preparer Tax Identification Number) required

Experience using CrossLink tax software

Strong spreadsheet skills (Excel or Google Sheets)

Fluent in English

Ability to work evening hours (Eastern Time)

Strong data entry and filing skills

Self-starter with the ability to work independently

Strong organizational and research skills

High attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications

Experience preparing both individual and small business returns

Bookkeeping or accounting experience

Experience with electronic filing systems

Customer service experience.

TYPE: Full-Time



About the Role

We’re looking for a Social Media Growth Manager to grow our audience and drive engagement using short-form content and community interaction. This role is focused on creating fun, high-performing content that gets people excited and coming back for more.This is more than just posting — you’ll help shape our social presence and turn attention into action.



What You’ll Do



Create and manage social content across
, Instagram, TikTok, and a few secondary platforms

Plan simple weekly/monthly content calendars around promotions, contests, and seasonal themes

Produce short-form video content (Reels, TikTok, Shorts)

Write captions with clear calls-to-action (shop, enter, vote, explore)

Engage with the community through comments and messages



What We’re Looking For



Comfortable creating and posting short-form social content

Creative, energetic, and aligned with a fun brand voice

Clear communicator 

Experience with AI or content tools is a plus



How to Apply



Send your resume, portfolio or social examples, and a short voice or video intro explaining why you’d be a great fit to:

title: Brand Visual Designer - CRO / Shopify
description:
We’re building a fast-growing Shopify DTC brand and are looking for a Brand Visual Designer who understands conversion, identity, and front-end performance.



This is not just graphic design.



You will own how the brand looks and converts across our website.



You will:



Design high-converting Shopify storefronts (colors, typography, layout, UI flow)



Improve product pages using CRO principles



Create on-brand visuals that increase trust and impulse buys



Optimize above-the-fold sections, PDP layouts, and mobile UX



Translate brand identity into a clear visual system



Analyze competitors and extract what actually works



Work closely with founder on brand direction



You must have:



Proven Shopify front-end design experience



Strong CRO knowledge (not just aesthetics)



Deep understanding of color psychology, hierarchy, and layout



Experience designing high-converting product pages



Figma + Adobe skills



Commercial mindset (design that sells)



Strong English communication



Not for you if:



You only make “pretty websites”



You don’t think about conversions



You can’t explain why a design choice increases sales



We want someone who designs with intent.



Long-term collaboration.



To apply:



Share 2–3 Shopify brands or product pages you designed



Explain one CRO improvement you made and its impact



Share your portfolio



Write READ at the top

title: Looking For A Researcher (GOLDEN JOB)
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented and reliable Researcher to assist with YouTube content and recent/current events research.



Responsibilities:



Conduct accurate and up-to-date research on trending topics and recent events



Gather supporting data, sources, and references for YouTube content



Verify facts and ensure information is credible



Organize findings clearly and efficiently



Requirements:



Must have a VPN



Strong communication skills



Reliable high-speed internet and a good working computer



Intermediate-level research experience



Ability to meet deadlines



To apply, please send your portfolio along with examples of previous research work.



Flat rate compensation will be discussed with selected candidates. Bonus pay may be added depending on performance.



Also, we've had issues with bot applications lately. To help us filter, please start your message with a fruit that's yellow when ripe — and if you enjoy baking, feel free to share a quick recipe for something tropical (we're always looking for snack ideas for the team).

title: Meta Ads Manager - Shopify Ecommerce
description:
We are an Australian Shopify Eyewear brand.  We run Meta Adavantage + and retargeting campaigns. 



We are looking for a part time Meta Ads Manager (25 hours per week) to 

-Manage existing campaigns

-Build new campaigns as needed

-Test creatives

-Optimise CPA

-Improve retargeting

-Provide weekly performance reports. 



Experience required;

-Strong experience running Advantage+ Shopping campaigns

-Experience working with Meta’s AI-driven optimisation (broad targeting, minimal audience layering)

-Focus on creative testing and performance-based scaling

-Understanding of blended ROAS and contribution margin

-Experience scaling campaigns using budget increases (not constant rebuilding)

-Ability to monitor CPA,ROAS,CTR, CPM and optimise accordingly. 

-Must provide examples of eCommerce campaigns managed and ROAS achieved. 

-Experience setting up and monitoring CAPI/pixel tracking.

title: Remote Email Marketing Specialist (US Mortgage Industry)
description:
—Please read the full job description before applying and include a link to your resume. Applications without this requirement will be automatically rejected.—



Job Title: Full Time Remote
 Marketing Specialist



Job Description: We are a growing mortgage company seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented
 Marketing Specialist to support our marketing initiatives. This role focuses on creating, scheduling, optimizing, and analyzing
 campaigns for lead generation, client engagement, and broker communication. If you have strong communication skills, a creative eye, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, we’d love to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities:

> Create, edit, and schedule
 marketing campaigns for internal and external audiences.

> Manage
 lists, segment audiences, and ensure accurate data entry in campaign platforms.

> Coordinate with the team to align messaging with brand and company goals.

> Monitor campaign performance and prepare basic analytics reports.

> Ensure all
 content complies with mortgage industry guidelines and brand standards.

> Assist in optimizing subject lines, content, and layouts to improve open and click rates.

> Maintain organized documentation of campaigns, templates, and marketing assets.



Qualifications:

> College or High School graduate.

> Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.

> Familiarity with
 marketing tools and basic data entry software.

> Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

> Ability to work independently and collaboratively.

> Creative mindset with an understanding of digital marketing basics.

> Experience in the mortgage industry or financial marketing is a plus.



Benefits:

> Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.

> Opportunities for professional growth and skills development.

> Paid training.

> Work-from-home setup.

> Opportunities for promotion and pay raises.



Job Type:

> Full Time (Remote)



Pay:

> TBD



Schedule:

> 12:30 am to 9:30 am Philippine Time (8-hours)

> Monday to Friday (with occasional weekend tasks, if required)

> Night shift alignment may be required depending on campaign schedules

title: Commission Only Cold Call Rep ( Call Center Agents )
description:
Job Description

We are a U.S.-based roofing and exterior company and also marketing company looking for motivated cold callers to set appointments with homeowners.

This is a commission-only position for callers who are confident in their ability to generate appointments consistently.

You may:

Use your own dialer



OR



Use our auto dialer system (training and scripts provided)



This is not a
 Ads or marketing job.

All work is done by phone calling homeowners.

High performers can earn strong weekly income.

Responsibilities

Make outbound calls to homeowners

Speak with homeowners and offer inspections or estimates

Schedule qualified appointments

Enter accurate appointment details

Follow scripts and company guidelines

Pay



$50 per qualified appointment when using your own dialer

$40 per qualified appointment when using our dialer



A qualified appointment means:

Homeowner agrees to an inspection or estimate

Valid phone number and property address

Appointment date and time scheduled

Homeowner or decision maker

Appointments are verified before payment. Duplicate, fake, or unqualified appointments will not be paid.

Requirements

Good spoken English

Comfortable making cold calls

Reliable internet and headset

Positive attitude and persistence

Cold calling or appointment setting experience preferred

To Apply

Please include:

Any cold calling or appointment setting experience

A short voice recording introducing yourself

Whether you plan to use your own dialer or ours

title: Doc Drawer (US Mortgage Company | Full-Time | Night Shift | Remote)
description:
Work Setup: 100% Remote (Work From Home)

Schedule: Monday to Friday | Night Shift (U.S. Pacific Time)

Employment Type: Full-Time | Long-Term Position



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based mortgage company looking for a Doc Drawer to join our growing operations team.



Your main responsibility is to prepare and generate accurate loan documents before closing. This is a critical position — errors in documentation can delay loan closings, so we are looking for someone who is highly detail-oriented and reliable.



If you are organized, focused, and serious about building a long-term career in the U.S. mortgage industry, this role is for you.



Fresh graduates are welcome to apply. Applicants with 1–2 years of U.S. mortgage experience are strongly preferred.



Training will be provided to the right candidate.



Key Responsibilities:

> Prepare and generate initial and closing loan documents

> Review loan approvals prior to document generation

> Verify borrower information, loan terms, fees, and rates

> Ensure documents meet compliance and investor guidelines

> Coordinate with processors, underwriters, and closing team

> Maintain internal tracking and documentation accuracy

> Ensure loan packages are complete before release



Qualifications

> Extremely detail-oriented (this is non-negotiable)

> Strong organizational and time management skills

> Good written English communication

> Basic to intermediate skills in Google Workspace or Microsoft Office

> Stable internet connection and quiet home workspace

> Willing to work night shift (PST schedule)

> Able to work independently without constant supervision



Preferred but Not Required

> Experience in U.S. mortgage (doc drawing, processing, closing, underwriting)

> Familiarity with mortgage disclosures and closing documents

> Experience working in a remote setup



What We Offer

> Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

> Stable, long-term position

> Monday–Friday work only (Weekends off)

> Growth opportunity in the U.S. mortgage industry

> Professional and supportive work environment



>> IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (READ CAREFULLY)



To be considered:

1. Send your application through OnlineJobs.ph

2. Include a DIRECT LINK to your resume (Google Drive / OneDrive / Dropbox)

3. Make sure the link is set to “Anyone with the link can view”

4. Include the word “DOCREADY” at the top of your application message



Applications without a resume link

Applications without the keyword “DOCREADY”

Resume links that require permission



? Will be automatically rejected.



We only review applicants who follow instructions. Attention to detail starts with your application.

title: TikTok Viral Video Editor – Paid Trial + Ongoing Program
description:
We are launching a consumer app and building a TikTok growth engine.



We are looking for short-form video editors who understand:

- Hooks

- Retention

- Native TikTok formats

- POV / relatable content

- Caption overlays

- Simple but engaging edits



This is a paid trial project (5 videos).



If performance is strong, you will be invited into our ongoing clipping program where you can earn performance-based payouts with breakout bonuses.



Trial Details:

- Create 5 short TikTok videos using our app screenshots.

- You will be given creative direction + examples.

- Videos must feel native to TikTok (no static slideshows).

- English content only.



We are testing:

- Hook strength

- Editing ability

- Retention instincts

- Understanding of viral structure



Compensation: 

Paid trial (fixed amount for 5 videos).

After trial, ongoing program pays:

- $1 per 1,000 views

- Breakout bonuses up to $1,000 per video

- Top performers can earn significantly more.



This is ideal if you:

- Already edit TikTok videos

- Understand viral pacing

- Can turn simple visuals into engaging content

- Want performance-based upside



This is NOT for:

- Corporate video editors

- Long-form YouTube editors

- Generic slideshow creators



To Apply



Send:

- Links to 3 TikTok videos you edited

- Your average view count

- Why you think you understand short-form hooks



We are hiring quickly and starting trials immediately.

title: Bookkeeper (QuickBooks Online) – Remote / Long-Term
description:
Bookkeeper (QuickBooks Online) – Remote / Long-Term

Company: Ironbooks

Location: Remote (Philippines only)

Job Type: Full-time

Shift: Preferably aligned with North American business hours



About the Role

At Ironbooks, we believe clean books create calm businesses. Behind every confident business owner is someone quietly making sure the numbers tell the truth.

We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Bookkeeper who takes pride in accuracy and finds satisfaction in bringing order to financial data. This role focuses on bookkeeping, reconciliations, and month-end preparation in QuickBooks Online (QBO).

This is NOT a client-facing role. Instead, you will work behind the scenes with clear SOPs and the guidance of senior accounting staff. Your work will directly impact the stability and growth of the businesses we support.

Watch This Before Applying

To better understand who we are and what we value, please watch this short video:





WHY THIS WOULD BE THE RIGHT FIT FOR YOU - By Kedma Ough



Responsibilities

Record and categorize transactions in QuickBooks Online

Maintain clean, organized, and accurate books

Perform bank and credit card reconciliations

Review accounts for errors or inconsistencies and proactively flag issues

Prepare books for month-end close

Assist with historical cleanup and catch-up work

Follow internal processes and documentation standards

Communicate issues clearly and professionally to senior tea
mbers

Requirements (Must Have)

2+ years bookkeeping experience

Strong QuickBooks Online experience (REQUIRED)

Experience with bank & credit card reconciliations

Experience preparing books for month-end close

High attention to detail and commitment to accuracy

Good written English

Able to work independently and meet deadlines

Stable internet and quiet work environment



Nice to Have (Not Required)

Experience with North American clients

Accounting or bookkeeping firm background

Experience with tools like Dext, Hubdoc, Stripe, Gusto, or similar

Familiarity with SOP-driven teams



What We Offer

Long-term, stable remote work with a team that values consistency

Clear expectations and structured workflows so you can focus on doing great work

A supportive accounting team that respects your role and contributions

Growth opportunities for high performers who want to build a lasting career



Why This Role Matters

The work may be behind the scenes, but it is never invisible. Accurate books create trust. Trust creates growth. Your consistency and precision will help business owners sleep better at night.



To Apply





Please include:

Your QuickBooks Online experience (years + type of work)

Your most recent bookkeeping role

Your availability and preferred working hours

Applications without QBO experience will not be considered.

title: VA Accountant
description:
We are looking for a VA Accountant with experience in U.S. tax accounting to prepare and review individual and business tax returns, ensure IRS compliance, and support tax planning and financial reporting. The role requires strong knowledge of QuickBooks and SAGE Intacct, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently in a remote setting while collaborating with the finance team during PST business hours.



Responsibilities:

-Prepare and review tax returns for individuals and businesses.

-Ensure all filings meet U.S. tax regulations and requirements.

-Assist in tax strategy development to boost financial efficiency.

-Stay on top of tax law changes and conduct research as needed.

-Support financial reporting for audits and tax-related documentation.

-Collaborate with the finance team to manage inquiries and ensure smooth operations.

-Keep accurate and organized financial records.



Qualifications:

-Proficiency in QuickBooks and SAGE Intacct is a must; CPA certification is a big plus.

-Solid experience in U.S. tax accounting (corporate & individual).

-Familiarity with tax software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAGE).

-Strong knowledge of IRS regulations and tax compliance.

-Detail-oriented, with excellent problem-solving skills.

-Strong communication skills (written & verbal).

-Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a remote setting.

-3-5 years of relevant experience in tax accounting (preferred)

title: HR Assistant
description:
This role is responsible for sourcing, screening, and coordinating top talent for real estate positions. The ideal candidate has recruiting experience, understands real estate roles, and can manage multiple hiring pipelines efficiently in a remote environment.



Job Description:

1. Support full-cycle recruitment for real estate and administrative roles, including Agents, Transaction Coordinators, Property Managers, Leasing Agents, and Admin/VA positions.

2. Create, post, and manage job advertisements across relevant job platforms and social channels.

3. Proactively source candidates via job boards, LinkedIn, and internal/external databases.

4. Screen resumes and conduct initial candidate interviews to assess qualifications and cultural fit.

5. Coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring smooth scheduling and communication.

6. Maintain accurate candidate pipelines and recruitment trackers to support hiring decisions.

7. Communicate professionally and timely with candidates throughout the hiring process.

8. Assist with onboarding preparation and hiring documentation as needed.

9. Maintain organized recruitment records and ensure data accuracy.

10. Provide general HR administrative support and assist with other HR-related tasks as assigned.



Qualifications: 

1. Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or related field

2. Experience as an HR Recruiter or Recruitment VA

3. Experience recruiting for real estate roles (preferred)

4. Strong English communication skills

5. Organized, detail-oriented, and reliable

6. Ability to work independently and remotely

7. Can work Pacific Standard Time (PST) hours

title: Junior Customer Support Assistant
description:
We are looking for a Junior Customer Support Assistant to join our growing team on a part-time basis.



We are an international e-commerce company that designs, produces, and ships our own clothing worldwide. Our main markets include the USA, UAE, and several countries across Europe. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a young, ambitious individual who wants to learn, grow, and build real skills inside a fast-paced online business.



Who We Are Looking For



- Maximum age: 25 years old

- Ambitious and eager to learn

- Strong communication skills

- Responsible and organized

- Comfortable working independently

- Not afraid to take initiative and share ideas



This is a junior role, so extensive experience in e-commerce or customer service is not required. However, you must understand the basics of how online stores operate and how customer service works. Most importantly, you must have the right mindset and a strong willingness to grow.



If you are motivated and show commitment, you will be rewarded for your effort and development.



What You Will Do



You will receive training to become responsible for customer communication and support. Your tasks will include:



- Responding to customer
s

- Handling customer questions via WhatsApp

- Managing social media messages

- Supporting the current customer service team

- Assisting with light administrative tasks

- Learning how to operate as a Virtual Assistant within an international e-commerce company



Over time, this role can grow into a full-time position with broader responsibilities.



What We Offer:



- Flexible working hours

- Remote work

- Training in customer service and e-commerce operations

- Real experience inside a growing international fashion brand

- Opportunity to grow into a larger role



As long as the work is completed properly and on time, you have achieved your goal. We value responsibility over micromanagement.



Important!

Please only apply if you are 25 years old or younger. This is specifically a junior, part-time development role.

If you are ready to grow, learn fast, and build real skills in international e-commerce, we would love to hear from you.

title: Client Success Manager
description:
JOB OVERVIEW



Sell More Homes | Tech Specialist | Full-Time



Sell More Homes is a 7-figure marketing and coaching company that helps real estate agents across North America systemize their businesses, and close more deals using Meta/YouTube ads, HighLevel CRM, AI, and virtual assistants.



We’re looking for a Tech Specialist to join our winning team! If you're a pro at marketing tech, CRM systems, and love helping others succeed, this role might be for you.



What You’ll Do:



Onboard New Clients:

Serve as the first tech touchpoint for new clients. You'll walk them through onboarding sessions, help them set up or connect their Meta 
) ad accounts and HighLevel CRM.



CRM Setup:

Set up and customize HighLevel CRM accounts for new clients – including pipelines, automations, integrations, workflows, and more.



Support & Troubleshooting:

Provide tech guidance, answer client questions about tools and integrations, and troubleshoot setup issues as needed.



---



What We’re Looking For:



* Proven experience with marketing platforms (especially Meta Ads and GoHighLevel CRM)

* Comfortable guiding non-technical clients through tech setup

* Excellent communication, organization, and follow-through

* A proactive team player who can manage multiple onboarding clients at once

* Detail-oriented and process-driven

* Fast learner who thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment

* Bonus: experience in real estate, digital marketing, or SaaS onboarding



---



Why Join Sell More Homes?



* Play a vital role in a fast-growing, impact-driven company

* Learn directly from a high-performing team and visionary founder

* Be part of a real estate marketing agency that recently earned HighLevel Gold SaaS status (2024) – and we’re aiming for Platinum in 2025

* Opportunity to grow into operations, client success, or product roles

* Work with passionate real estate professionals across North America

* 100% remote



---



Apply now and help shape the future of real estate in North America



Apply Here:

title: Social Media Creative Producer
description:
This is a full-time position as a social media creative producer. You will work directly with the lead media buyer to create social media ads & videos to be published on organic/paid social platforms. Mostly Meta.



You need to understand why ads work. 

Understanding of direct response principles for service businesses.



-Problem ? agitation ? solution.

-Pain-led hooks, not brand fluff.

-Clear offer, clear CTA.

-Ability to think in angles, not just ideas.

-Emotional angles (fear, relief, hope, identity).

-Logical angles (cost, time, outcomes, alternatives).

-Awareness of platforms like Meta, TikTok, YouTube Shorts.

title: Backend Developer (TypeScript / Node.js) – AI Telephony & Webhook Integration
description:
About the Role



We are building a production AI-powered communications platform that handles:



Inbound phone calls (Twilio)

Business-hours call routing logic



Background job scheduling

We already have detailed technical specs and core logic defined.

Your role is to implement and integrate these utilities into our existing NestJS backend.



This is not a research role and not a frontend role.

This is structured backend integration work.



What You’ll Be Doing

Implement Twilio webhook signature validation



Apply business-hours logic to outbound call routing



Add request guards and return proper HTTP 403 responses when needed



Write and run Jest tests



Debug edge cases (timezones, malformed payloads, webhook retries)



Follow written specifications precisely



You will not be redesigning the system architecture.



Required Skills



Strong TypeScript



Node.js experience



Experience with REST APIs and webhooks

Comfortable working in a structured codebase

Nice to Have



NestJS experience



Twilio experience

What This Role Is NOT

Not chatbot prompt engineering



Not open-ended experimentation



This is backend systems execution.



Work Setup



Remote

Task-based workflow



Clear written specs provided



Code reviewed before merge



To Apply

title: Full-Time AI Video Producer & Editor — Permanent Role with U.S. Company (All AI Tools Provided)
description:
About Us

We are a U.S.-based AI video production company located in Rhode Island. We serve clients in real estate, insurance, brand storytelling, and character-driven animation. We've been in video production since 2019 and have worked with high-profile clients across multiple industries.

This is a permanent, salaried position with daily work. We have long-term client partnerships that guarantee consistent production year-round. We are building a team — not cycling through freelancers.

About the salary range: We listed a wide range because we're open to different experience levels. If you're a strong traditional editor who's eager to grow into AI video, we'll start you at a fair rate and invest in your development. If you're already producing broadcast-quality AI video and can hit the ground running, we'll pay accordingly — up to $3,500/month for the right person. We believe in paying well for excellent work.



Why This Job Is Different

We provide ALL AI tools and software subscriptions. You will not need to pay for any AI video platforms out of pocket. Once you're part of the team, we give you full access to the tools you need — including platforms like Sora, VEO, Kling, Runway, Pika, HeyGen, and others as needed. We also provide Adobe Creative Cloud if required.

We know these tools are expensive. We invest in our team so you can focus on doing great work instead of worrying about subscription costs.

What else we offer:



Monthly salary starting at $500/month for promising candidates, scaling up to $3,500/month for top performers — we pay for results and commitment, not just hours

Salary paid consistently (weekly during your first 2 months, then bi-monthly)

13th month bonus in December

All AI tool subscriptions and software covered by us

Training on our specific workflows and client standards

Real career growth — we promote from within and reward strong performers with raises and leadership opportunities

Payment via Wise, PayPal, or your preferred method





What You'll Be Doing

Your day-to-day work will include:



Creating AI-generated video content using multiple platforms — selecting the right tool for each creative challenge

Building and animating realistic digital avatars with accurate lip sync, natural facial expressions, and believable body language

Editing and polishing final videos in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, or DaVinci Resolve — including transitions, motion graphics, captions, color correction, and audio mixing

Translating scripts and client briefs into visual content across corporate, cinematic, and commercial styles

Quality-checking every deliverable for consistency in character appearance, lighting, pacing, and overall professional standard





Who We're Looking For

We need someone who treats AI as a creative tool, not a shortcut. The right person has three qualities:

1. High standards for quality. You notice artifacts, background warping, unnatural blinking, and lip sync issues before anyone else. Color correction and lighting continuity are part of your process from the start — not finishing touches.

2. Understanding of AI video tools. You don't need to own subscriptions to every platform, but you should understand what different AI video tools can do and how they compare. If you've used free tiers, watched breakdowns, experimented during trials, or studied these tools closely — that counts. We will give you full access once you're on the team.

3. Strong post-production skills. Creating the AI clip is only half the job. Editing, pacing, sound design, compositing, and storytelling are the other half. You should be comfortable and confident in Premiere Pro, After Effects, or DaVinci Resolve.



Technical Requirements



Hands-on experience or demonstrated knowledge of 2 or more AI video platforms (HeyGen, Kling, VEO, Runway, Midjourney, Pika, Sora, etc.)

Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects (or DaVinci Resolve)

Portfolio showing strong visual storytelling, pacing, and compositional sense

Clear English communication — you'll interpret creative briefs and collaborate directly with our team

Reliable internet connection and a computer capable of running video editing software smoothly





How to Apply — Please Read Carefully

We review every application personally. To help us find the right person, please include the following in your application:

1. Show us your work. Share 2-3 video samples. We are looking for:



AI-generated video work if you have it (even free-tier or watermarked samples are fine — we understand tool access is limited)

Polished post-production work (editing, color, motion graphics, sound design)

Avatar-focused or character-driven examples will put you at the top of the list

If you don't have AI video samples, show us your strongest traditional editing work AND explain which AI video tools you've studied or experimented with and what you know about their strengths and limitations



2. Tell us why this role fits you. In a few sentences (not a copy-paste cover letter), explain what about this position matches where you are in your career and why you're looking for something permanent.

3. Include the word "Storyboard" at the beginning of your application so we know you read the full post.

Important: Applications without any work samples will not be reviewed. You don't need a perfect portfolio — but we need to see evidence of your skills and your eye for quality.

title: YouTube Video Editor
description:
We are building a serious YouTube media brand. 
_



This is not a casual vlog.



We are a family building resorts around the world, and raising 4 kids unconventionally, and documenting business, adventure, faith, and growth.



We need a sharp editor who understands:



• Hook psychology

• Retention pacing

• Emotional storytelling

• Modern YouTube rhythm

• Clean sound design



You will not just trim clips.



You will shape stories.



What You’ll Do:



- Edit 1 long-form YouTube video per week (8–12 min)



- Create 3 short cutdowns from each video



- Design thumbnails



- Package titles/descriptions for upload



- Add music, light motion graphics (like maps, & overlays)



- Improve our story structure, not just execute instructions



- We will send a short voice memo explaining story direction. You are expected to ask any clarifying questions you need answered, and then elevate it.



This Is NOT For You If:



- You need step-by-step instructions for every cut



- You edit chronologically without tension



- You rely on slow pacing (or fast pacing) on every video



- You only copy what other creators do



- You can’t take direct feedback



This IS For You If:



- You think in hooks and curiosity loops



- You cut aggressively for pacing



- You understand YouTube retention graphs



- You care about audience psychology



- You want to grow with a long-term brand



Required Skills:



- Advanced Premiere Pro



- Strong English comprehension & communication



- Experience editing 8–30 min YouTube videos



- Good internet for large file transfers



Bonus:



- Thumbnail design



- Basic motion graphics

Most applicants will be ignored.

title: Greek-Life Custom Apparel - Multiple Roles (Operations / Sales / Design)

We’re looking for experienced professionals in the Greek-life custom apparel space—people who already understand the chaos, the timelines, and the expectations behind Bid Day drops, recruitment rushes, and last-minute revisions.

Greek custom apparel experience is required.

PRODUCTION COORDINATOR

-Comfortable in a fast-moving, high-expectation environment

Why Work With Us:

title: Creative Execution & Brand Delivery Assistant (Design Studio)
description:
Kamusta!!

We are a boutique design studio led by a Filipina founder who built the business through heart, taste, and genuine care for her clients.



This is not a corporate agency.

This is a growing, family-led studio.



Clients work with us because they trust the founder’s creative direction, communication, and integrity. As the studio grows, we are looking for someone to join us long-term and become part of the team behind the scenes.



We offer services including:

• Branding & Rebrands

• Packaging Design

• Web Design

• Social Media Systems

• Brand Strategy

• Illustration & Visual Assets

• Creative Direction



The founder leads all client communication and high-level creative decisions.



We are hiring a Creative Execution & Delivery Assistant whose role is to take already-started projects and bring them to completion — clean, polished, and ready for handoff.



You will not be starting concepts from scratch.

You will be refining, expanding, and preparing approved work.



Your role includes:



Refining & Completing Design Work

• Expanding approved logos into full logo systems

• Polishing typography, spacing, and layout

• Applying branding to packaging dielines

• Preparing web assets for developer handoff

• Creating social templates from approved brand systems

• Finalizing illustrations or supporting graphics based on direction



Preparing Production-Ready Files

• Setting up packaging files with proper bleed and CMYK

• Exporting complete logo packages (AI, EPS, SVG, PNG, JPG, PDF)

• Preparing optimized web and social assets

• Organizing website imagery and brand files



Organizing & Packaging Final Deliverables

• Cleaning and organizing working files

• Following clear naming conventions

• Building structured folder systems

• Creating simple brand guideline PDFs from templates

• Preparing professional delivery folders for clients



You will NOT:

• Speak directly with clients

• Join discovery calls

• Lead creative strategy

• Override creative direction



You will be trusted to take projects from 80% to 100%.



We are looking for someone who:

• Is strong in Adobe Illustrator (required)

• Understands packaging and basic print production

• Has strong attention to detail

• Can follow direction precisely

• Takes pride in clean files and organized systems

• Is looking for a stable, respectful, long-term working relationship



This is a family-led business.

We value loyalty, consistency, and mutual respect.

If you grow with us, there is long-term opportunity.



To apply, include:

1. The word “Precision” at the top of your application

2. A short explanation of how you would prepare a logo package for delivery

Salamat!!

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Receive incoming phone calls and live chats from potential customers (prospects) who indicated that they need shopping assistance. This does not include calls and chats from existing customers that need help with their orders (that’s a job for a different department)

Help customers choose the right gas or electric heating appliance for their needs

Makes follow-up calls, writes follow-up
s, and text messages to potential buyers. We try to follow up 5x with each person that contacted us (unless they indicate that they are no longer interested). We don’t do cold calling. Only reaching out to prospects who interacted with our online store and left their contact information.

After each interaction with a prospect/customer, writes notes & comments in our CRM (Asana)

Communicate efficiently and build rapport with potential customers

Assists prospects in their shopping journey and helps make the purchase decision

Ensures that all prospects’ questions and objections are addressed

Leads every interaction to a close sale, which means an order is placed on our online store

Prepares custom quotes, price matches competitors if necessary, and offers custom discounts. This requires calculating margins & ensuring profitability.

Answering questions about the products we offer, including technical questions. Learns the specifications, features and benefits of our bestsellers. Over time, becomes an expert in the industry.

Explain technical specifications and installation requirements in simple terms

If not able to answer product-specific questions, conducts research in the materials provided by the supplier, or reaches out to the supplier to get the information

Confirms stock availability and lead times when offering products to prospects

Documents standard procedures and best practices in a written form, so that other tea
mbers can learn from them





Requirements:

Sales Experience – 2+ years, preferably with B2C or B2B technical products

Gas Plumbing or Electrical Experience – Formal training or work experience (installer, technician, or similar roles preferred)

Excellent English – Both written and spoken

Confident Communicator – Can explain complex concepts to non-technical customers

Tech-Savvy – Comfortable using CRMs,
 platforms, order tools, etc.

Reliable and Proactive – Takes initiative and works independently

Home Office Setup – Stable internet, noise-free environment, backup power is a plus





Preferred but Not Required:

Knowledge of venting, HVAC, or hearth appliances

US product or code familiarity

Experience in the construction or home improvement industry





Why Join Us?

Sales commission: 8% of gross profit from all orders closed. Gross profit means the sale amount minus the product and shipping cost. Paid monthly. No upper limit. Monthly commission payouts range between $1,200 (the guaranteed minimum) and as high as $3,000 (for the top performer). The average monthly payout is $1,465 (average from the last 2 years).

$1,200/month minimum guaranteed pay

15 days paid days off per year (also convertible to min. guaranteed commission)

Paid training on all aspects of the role

Opportunities for professional development

Friendly atmosphere

Online Interview process

Fully remote position





How to Apply:

Apply through OnlineJobs.ph with the subject line: "Sales Pro - [Your Name]"

title: Graphic Designer / Production Artist
description:
DTF Virginia is seeking an experienced Graphic Designer / Production Artist who fully understands DTF production requirements, Roland workflows, and specialty-effect artwork. This position requires someone who can consistently deliver accurate, print-ready files without oversight or rework.



This role supports customers who submit artwork via
, requiring precise interpretation of specifications and flawless production execution.

Core Responsibilities (Daily Work)

• Create accurate, error-free gang sheets for customers who submit artwork via
, strictly following provided specifications (sizes, quantities, spacing, and layout).

• Vector, redraw, clean up, and improve customer artwork as needed.

• Prepare artwork specifically for DTF printing, including correct sizing, clean vectors, smooth edges, optimized paths, and production-safe line thickness.

• Identify and correct issues that could impact print quality or adhesion.

• Add clean, accurate cut lines for Roland print/cut workflows.

• Prepare fully print-ready files for Roland production with no downstream adjustments.

• Create and prepare spangle files for production use.

• Apply faux specialty effects including faux embroidery (digitized embroidery-style artwork), faux glitter, sparkle, textured, and 3D effects.

• Understand and apply digitizing principles when creating embroidery-style effects for print.

• Apply spot colors correctly for textured UV printing.

• Create clean, print-safe halftone artwork.

• Accurately replicate fonts when required.

• Deliver files that are complete, accurate, and print-ready upon receipt.

Required Skills & Experience

• Advanced proficiency in Adobe Illustrator (vector-based production workflow).

• Proven experience preparing artwork for DTF printing in a production environment.

• Strong understanding of Roland print/cut requirements.

• Hands-on experience with spangle files and specialty-effect artwork.

• Excellent attention to detail and production accuracy.

• Ability to work independently and manage deadlines.

• True design and production skills required – AI-generated artwork is not acceptable for this role.

Schedule & Expectations

Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM–5:00 PM (East Coast hours).

This role requires minimal supervision.

Files must be correct the first time—accuracy is critical to production flow.

title: YouTube Production Coordinator
description:
| About Unlimited Video Editing (UVE)



Unlimited Video Editing partners with serious YouTube creators to help them edit high quality videos consistently and grow sustainably.



Our clients range from:



- High-energy creators

- Long-form podcasts
